content.description: On the North face of the boulder sit start on crimp rails near the NE corner and head straight up using a two finger pocket and other rails to the top. Though small for this area this problem has nice movement that I thought made it worthy of a record.
content.location: Northface of the Big J boulder where many roots seep through it's wall. Nice warmup to the area

content.description: Start from a sitting/kneeling position on the lowest rail above the cave. Use the good edges to make your way to the big hueco. Climb up and slightly right through 2 finger pockets and top out. Avoid holds around the aret to the left.
content.protection: At least 3 pads and two spotters. The landing is two tiered making it more dangerous.
content.location:
On the West(front) face above the cave.  

  Start matched on the lowest rail. 

  Walk off to the North.

content.description:
This is the big boulder greeting you as you approach the lower Gutter boulder field. It is 15' tall and very large with pockets all over the left(north/west) face. The first established Gutter climb is on the West face above the little cave, and there will surely be more to come. This boulder is simply awesome. 

  There is a J chiseled into the front of this boulder.
